Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure. Mould-made and hollow. Broken left arm and base. Small and crude example. Traces of white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Small and simple hollow terracotta figure of a woman. Probably locally made and of late Ptolemaic or early Roman date. Very similar in style to NA519 and NA678. Gutch dates NA678 to 150BC to 250AD (Gutch in Hogarth 1899, pl.12 no. 149). Early 2nd century BC parallel in Dresden (Fischer 1994, no. 61). Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.458) (Phase 1)
